messages.content:
You are a systematic literature review (SLR) screening assistant.


DOMAIN: AI/ML/DL applications in ophthalmology and eye diseases.

RELEVANT DISEASES:
- Diabetic Retinopathy
- Glaucoma
- Cataract
- Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)
- Retinal disorders (retinopathy, retinal detachment, etc.)
- Ophthalmic conditions (keratoconus, dry eye, etc.)
- Any eye/vision-related diseases

RELEVANT TASKS:
- Diagnosis
- Detection
- Classification
- Severity grading
- Prediction
- Segmentation
- Screening

RELEVANT METHODS:
- Artificial Intelligence (AI)
- Machine Learning (ML)
- Deep Learning (DL)
- Neural Networks (CNN, RNN, Transformers, etc.)
- Computer Vision
- Image Analysis


================================================================================
TASK: Evaluate this paper ABSTRACT for inclusion.
(This paper passed title screening)
================================================================================

TITLE: Bi-Unet: Encoder-decoder Based Network for Lesion Segmentation of Diabetic Retinopathy Images
ABSTRACT: Diabetic Retinopathy (DR) is a prevalent complication of diabetes mellitus and a leading cause of adult blindness worldwide. In this study, we propose a multiclass segmentation method for DR images using a codec structure. Specifically, we use an encoder to down-sample the image, followed by feature extraction using a quadruple Multi-scale Receptive Field (MSRF) module to address uneven lesion distribution. We then apply the Bi-layer Feature Fusion (BiLFF) module mechanism to fuse feature maps obtained from down-sampling. This mechanism adaptively learns important foci parts of the features while reducing interference from non-important healthy eye information. Finally, we up-sample the fused features and cascade them with feature maps obtained from corresponding down-sampling. We perform feature extraction on cascaded feature maps to obtain final predicted segmentation maps. Our method achieves state-of-the-art results on the DDR dataset.

================================================================================
SELECTION RULES (BE INCLUSIVE - DO NOT MISS RELEVANT PAPERS):
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Abstract_Selected
IF ANY of the following is TRUE:
- Abstract confirms AI/ML/DL method for eye disease
- Abstract describes automated diagnosis/detection for ophthalmology
- Abstract mentions dataset of retinal/fundus/OCT images with ML analysis
- Abstract is UNCLEAR but suggests AI application in eye care
- Abstract describes deep learning model for any eye condition

OUTPUT: Abstract_Deleted
ONLY IF the abstract CLEARLY confirms:
- This is a review/survey/meta-analysis paper (not primary research)
- No AI/ML/DL methodology is used at all
- The disease is NOT eye-related
- The paper is editorial/commentary/opinion only

================================================================================
IMPORTANT: When abstract is missing or unclear, SELECT (Abstract_Selected).
We prefer false positives over missing relevant papers.
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Respond with EXACTLY one label only (no explanation):
Abstract_Selected
OR
Abstract_Deleted

YOUR RESPONSE:
